channel.title: World : NPR
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2023 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Earthquake survivors in southern Turkey struggle with mental health two months later
item.description: Two months after the deadly earthquakes in southern Turkey, millions of survivors are coping with the mental health toll of the horrific disaster.
item.content:encoded: Two months after the deadly earthquakes in southern Turkey, millions of survivors are coping with the mental health toll of the horrific disaster.
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: A hundred years later, a Welsh women's peace petition returns home
item.description: A Welsh petition for world peace sat forgotten in the Smithsonian for nearly 100 years. This week, it finally returned to Wales for its signatures to be digitized and its history remembered.
item.content:encoded: A Welsh petition for world peace sat forgotten in the Smithsonian for nearly 100 years. This week, it finally returned to Wales for its signatures to be digitized and its history remembered.
item.dc:creator: Megan Lim

item.title: Despite airstrikes and drive-by shooting, Israeli-Palestinian flare-up hasn't spiraled
item.description: A shooting attack killed two Israeli women in the West Bank. But otherwise there seem to be efforts to limit an escalation.
item.content:encoded: A shooting attack killed two Israeli women in the West Bank. But otherwise there seem to be efforts to limit an escalation.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Live Easter reenactments resume in the Philippines despite Catholic Church objections
item.description: The real-life reenactments in the farming village of San Pedro Cutud in Pampanga province north of Manila resumed after a three-year pause because of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.content:encoded:
The real-life reenactments in the farming village of San Pedro Cutud in Pampanga province north of Manila resumed after a three-year pause because of the coronavirus pandemic.

(Image credit: Aaron Favila/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The World Health Organization turns 75
item.description: The World Health Organization turns 75 today. Forged in the years following World War II, many hoped people would finally work together to eradicate some of the world's worst diseases.
item.content:encoded: The World Health Organization turns 75 today. Forged in the years following World War II, many hoped people would finally work together to eradicate some of the world's worst diseases.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Concerns are raised that China may return defectors back to North Korea
item.description: International organizations are concerned about North Korean defectors detained in China. They could soon be repatriated to North Korea, where they might face harsh punishment.
item.content:encoded: International organizations are concerned about North Korean defectors detained in China. They could soon be repatriated to North Korea, where they might face harsh punishment.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Israeli medics say 2 are killed in an attack in the West Bank
item.description: An alleged shooting attack in the northern occupied West Bank killed two women and seriously wounded another, Israeli medics said on Friday.
item.content:encoded:
An alleged shooting attack in the northern occupied West Bank killed two women and seriously wounded another, Israeli medics said on Friday.

(Image credit: Fatima Shbair/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: White House defends Afghanistan pullout, blames Trump administration for lack of prep
item.description: The Biden administration issued an analysis of the U.S. pulling military presence from Afghanistan. The White House defends withdrawing but blames the Trump administration for a lack of preparedness.
item.content:encoded: The Biden administration issued an analysis of the U.S. pulling military presence from Afghanistan. The White House defends withdrawing but blames the Trump administration for a lack of preparedness.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Residents of islands belonging to Taiwan are at the center of growing tensions
item.description: Tensions between China and Taiwan have been on the rise in recent years. But a quiet battle is already taking place: the competition for hearts and minds.
item.content:encoded: Tensions between China and Taiwan have been on the rise in recent years. But a quiet battle is already taking place: the competition for hearts and minds.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Violence ignites after raids at Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem
item.description: After two days of Israeli police raids in the Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem, militants fired rockets into Israel from Gaza and Lebanon — raising fears of an escalating conflict.
item.content:encoded: After two days of Israeli police raids in the Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem, militants fired rockets into Israel from Gaza and Lebanon — raising fears of an escalating conflict.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: NBA's Patty Mills gives young Indigenous Australians a league of their own
item.description: NPR's Adrian Florido speaks with NBA player Patty Mills, point guard now of the Brooklyn Nets, about his work in organizing the Indigenous Basketball Association in his native Australia.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Florido speaks with NBA player Patty Mills, point guard now of the Brooklyn Nets, about his work in organizing the Indigenous Basketball Association in his native Australia.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: UN struggles to convince the Taliban to allow Afghan women to deliver aid
item.description: The United Nations has a difficult balancing act in Afghanistan. The humanitarian needs are great. But the Taliban are no longer allowing female Afghan aid workers to deliver assistance.
item.content:encoded: The United Nations has a difficult balancing act in Afghanistan. The humanitarian needs are great. But the Taliban are no longer allowing female Afghan aid workers to deliver assistance.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Pakistan's 'Joyland' explores gender and sexuality in a world of social rigidity
item.description: Banned in Pakistan, the film Joyland chronicles a young married man's travails after he gets a job as a backup dancer in a revue featuring a trans performer.
item.content:encoded: Banned in Pakistan, the film Joyland chronicles a young married man's travails after he gets a job as a backup dancer in a revue featuring a trans performer.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern takes on a new role after leaving politics this week
item.description: In a rousing and personal farewell speech this week in parliament, the former prime minister touched on family, politics and one of the very few things she will ask of her colleagues as she departs.
item.content:encoded:
In a rousing and personal farewell speech this week in parliament, the former prime minister touched on family, politics and one of the very few things she will ask of her colleagues as she departs.

(Image credit: Mark Coote/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Patrick Wood

item.title: Debris is found during a search for a Japanese army helicopter carrying 10
item.description: A missing Black Hawk carrying 10 crew members is believed to have crashed into the sea off a southern island after objects appearing to be aircraft parts were spotted in the area, an official said.
item.content:encoded:
A missing Black Hawk carrying 10 crew members is believed to have crashed into the sea off a southern island after objects appearing to be aircraft parts were spotted in the area, an official said.

(Image credit: Kyodo News via AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
